gurmukhi: ruly q`C mu`CM prI g`C qIrM ]4]160]
transliteration: Rule Tachchh Mouchchannd Daroo Gadhchh Tooran||4||160||
translation: The chopped bodies were being trodden in the dust and because of the infliction of arrows, the warriors were becoming senseless.4.160.
The warriors fell in the battlefield along with the elephants and goads.
The headless trunks began to dance senselessly.

gurmukhi: aufYN biR`D giR`DM rVYN kMk bMkM ]
transliteration: Udain Briddh Griddhan Radain Kank Bankan||
translation: The large-sized vultures began to fly and the crows with curved beaks began to caw.

gurmukhi: Bkw BuMk ByrI Bhw fUh fMkM ]5]161]
transliteration: Bhakaa Bhounk Bheroo Dahaa Dooh Dankan||5||161||
translation: The frightful sound of drums and the clatter of tabors was heard.5.161.

gurmukhi: tkw tu`k topM Fkw Fu`k FwlM ]
transliteration: Takaa Toukk Topan Dhakaa Dhoukk Dhaalan||
translation: There was knocking of helmets and the sound of blows on the shields.
The swords began to chop the bodies with terrible noises.

gurmukhi: hlw cwl bIrM Dmw DMim swNgM ]
transliteration: Halaa Dhaal Booran Dhamaa Dhanm(i) Saanadg||
translation: The warriors were attacked continuously and the clatter of daggers was being heard.

gurmukhi: prI hwl hUlM suixE log nwgM ]6]162]
transliteration: Daroo Baal Hoolan Sounio Log Naagadg||6||162||
translation: There was such consternation that its noise was heard in the netherworld by the Nagas.6.162.
Headless trunks and the kapalikas are dancing in the battlefield.
All the gods appear pleased and the demon-king is getting furious.

gurmukhi: ikDo Agn juAwlM BXo Awp BysM ]7]163]
transliteration: Kidho Agad Juaalan Bhayo Aap Bhesan||7||163||
translation: It appears that the flame of fire is blazing.7.163.
